file_content.text: Before we hit the Esh-kha, you should know something.
Intelligence cracked the records we found. Apparently this prison's thousands of years old. Built by something called Rakata.
Seems our friends were busy annihilating every species they could find. These Rakata thinned the Esh-kha's numbers, and put the survivors in stasis.
The Esh-kha will pick up where they left off, unless we stop them.
Their reign of chaos ends now.
You're right, my lord. I know just how to crush their escape plans.
I didn't know these creatures were so accomplished. Pity I'll have to kill them.
Impressive.
They're something, all right. And it's about time someone brought them down to size.
The Esh-kha will attempt to return to their conquering ways.
Now they're back at work.
Exactly. And you're our only chance at stopping them.
Esh-kha taste their own medicine, big paydays all around?
So it's another job?
Yes. Take all the trophies you want, just don't leave any squirming.
They should have wiped out every last Esh-kha.
The Rakata were too forgiving.
Would've saved us a headache, all right.
Spare me their history.
You're right. History later, action first.
While you were gone, we detected a spike in Esh-kha activity. Sent one of my officers to get a look.
A look, second-degree burns and some cracked ribs. But it was worth it.
I spotted an Esh-kha lieutenant. Heavily guarded, armed to the teeth. He rampaged between vaults, freeing his friends easily.
That brute's our key holder. And if we don't stop him soon, we can kiss Belsavis goodbye--along with any hope of freeing the Dread Masters.
That fiend's our key holder, all right. And if we don't stop him soon, we can kiss Belsavis goodbye--along with the inmates we're trying to free.
Our mission on Belsavis won't fall to a crew of rogue aliens. I'll see to it.
I will take the Esh-kha's key.
Excellent. We can't waste any time.
I'm charging double this time. Once for the Esh-kha, once for the key.
You're about to owe me big.
I can meet those demands. But move quickly--more than credits are at stake.
Hysterics don't suit you, Colonel. The Esh-kha aren't that powerful.
Don't be so dramatic.
Those creatures are more dangerous than you realize. Imperial Command agrees.
I could help, but will I?
Now's not the time for cold feet.
Commander Calum won't chance letting the Esh-kha escape Belsavis. He'll bombard the site from orbit if we fail.
You're our only hope, my lord. Please--kill that Esh-kha, get the key, before it's too late.
We can still salvage this operation. But only if you assassinate that Esh-kha and secure the key.
Earn your pay. Kill that Esh-kha, and recover his key.
The clock's ticking. Kill that Esh-kha and secure the key, before it's too late.
Colonel. I've dealt with the Esh-kha, but this isn't over. I have news you won't like....
One vault of Esh-kha's bad enough, but a whole planet...? If they use that key, the fiends'll be everywhere.
But now we know this key exists, we've got a chance at stopping them. Good work.
No thanks necessary, Colonel.
Anything for the Empire.
I enjoyed the hunt.
Glad to hear. But the fight's not over, and we've just received new intel.
They were hardly a challenge.
The next group won't be so vulnerable.
Good work deserves higher pay.
The job's not over yet. And we just received new intel.
We must stop the Esh-kha soon.
Agreed. But know your enemy, that's what I say.
